alert.note: Alert for South Central Highlands; Upper Tularosa Valley (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 7:15PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF WEST CENTRAL LINCOLN AND SOUTHEASTERN SOCORRO COUNTIES THROUGH 745 PM MDT... At 714 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 19 miles southeast of Bingham, or 20 miles west of Carrizozo, moving east at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of west central Lincoln and southeastern Socorro Counties. This includes Highway 380 between Mile Markers 48 and 51. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building.

area.areaDesc: South Central Highlands; Upper Tularosa Valley
